citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC)
citeinfo.title: High Resolution Seismic Reflection Profiles Navarin Basin - North Bering Sea, Alaska

descript.abstract: Approximately 1,600-line km of high-resolution seismic reflection data are now available in the Navarin Basin, northern Bering Sea. The data were collected in August 1982 from the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Research Vessel S.P. LEE and deals with seafloor hazards pertinent to Outer Continental Shelf oil and gas lease sale activity. Microfile copies of the seismic records are available for purchase from the National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC). The U.S. Geological Survey, Department of Interior has provided these data to NGDC for public dissemination.
descript.purpose: A report on the HIGH-RESOLUTION SEISMIC REFLECTION PROFILES Navarin Basin - North Bering Sea, Alaska

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
